summary_points.title: IT Stocks Drive Fifth Straight Day of Gains
summary_points.summary: Indian equities extended their winning streak to five sessions, led by heavyweights in the IT sector. The Nifty50 added 69.90 points (0.28%) to finish at 25,050.55, with Infosys jumping 3.88% and TCS up 2.69%, offsetting modest losses in other large-caps and supporting a broadly positive market tone.

summary_points.title: Five-Day Winning Streak Continues
summary_points.summary: The domestic equity market extended its winning run to a fifth straight session, with Nifty50 rising by 69.90 points (0.28%) to 25,050.55 and Sensex adding 213.45 points (0.26%) to close at 81,857.84. This run underscores sustained positive momentum driven by robust buying interest and healthy institutional flows.

summary_points.title: IT Stocks Lead the Charge
summary_points.summary: Substantial gains in the IT pack powered the latest market upswing, with Infosys climbing nearly 3.9% and TCS up 2.7%. Other technology names such as Tech Mahindra and HCL Tech also outperformed, highlighting the sector’s resilience amid global technology sell-offs and supporting broader market optimism.

summary_points.title: IT Stocks Drive Fifth Straight Session of Gains
summary_points.summary: Indian equity benchmarks notched a fifth consecutive day of gains as the NSE Nifty rose 0.28% and the BSE Sensex climbed 0.26%, led by robust IT sector performance. Infosys surged 3.88% and TCS gained 2.69%, while gains in Hindustan Unilever, NTPC, and Tech Mahindra further underpinned the rally.

summary_points.title: Global Weakness Clouds Early Trade
summary_points.summary: Asian markets fell sharply—Japan’s Nikkei down 1.32%, South Korea’s Kospi off 1.26%—while U.S. indices ended lower as tech stocks were sold off. Gift Nifty was trading at around 24,963, a discount of nearly 70 points, pointing to a potentially softer open for domestic indices.

summary_points.title: Policy Support and Institutional Flows Bolster Momentum
summary_points.summary: Market strategists highlighted that sector-specific relief measures, continuing government policy support, and robust institutional inflows would likely underpin the prevailing positive momentum in equities. These factors are expected to sustain activity and investor confidence across key sectors in the near term.

articles.title: Stock market today: Nifty50 ends above 25,000; BSE Sensex up over 200 points - Times of India
articles.snippet: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, ended Wednesday in green, for the fifth consecutive positive session, primarily driven by substantial IT sector gains.The NSE Nifty recorded a rise of 69.90 points or 0.28 per cent, finishing at 25,050.55.

articles.title: Sensex ends 213 points higher, Nifty above 25,000; Infosys up 4% - India Today
articles.snippet: The S&P BSE Sensex gained 213.45 points to close at 81,857.84, while the NSE Nifty50 added 69.90 points to end at 25,050.55.

top_performing_sectors.explanation: IT stocks led the Aug 20 rally—Infosys jumped nearly 3.9% and TCS gained 2.7%—driven by robust digital‐transformation spending.
Auto shares, led by Maruti Suzuki, saw strong buying after GST‐reform optimism and healthy domestic demand forecasts.
Realty and consumer durables/FMCG names advanced on improving consumer sentiment and a continued real estate upcycle.

underperforming_sectors.explanation: Power stocks came under selling pressure amid mixed global cues and lingering policy concerns.
Despite the subsequent rally, the IT sector saw profit-taking in earlier sessions, reflecting mixed global tech demand.
Financials, including Bajaj Finance, lagged on profit-booking as markets consolidated after recent gains.

gainers.name: Maruti Suzuki
gainers.reason: Rallied as investors cheered proposed GST reforms that are expected to benefit the auto sector.

gainers.name: Bajaj Finance
gainers.reason: Surged on broader optimism around consumer durables spending amid anticipated GST rationalisation.

gainers.name: UltraTech Cement
gainers.reason: Advanced on strength in realty stocks, with market participants expecting GST reforms to boost the sector.

losers.name: ITC
losers.reason: Underperformed as sectoral rotation into auto and consumer names weighed on defensive stocks.

losers.name: Eternal
losers.reason: Declined amid mixed trading conditions, with selling pressure in non-core sectors overshadowing the broader rally.

losers.name: Tech Mahindra
losers.reason: Slipped on sustained selling pressure in the IT segment despite broader market gains.

market_drivers.summary: Today’s rally was driven by a confluence of factors: auto stocks led the charge after reports of a possible GST cut on vehicles and China’s assurance on rare‐earth magnets for EVs, while Reliance Industries jumped on bullish brokerage calls and Jio’s prepaid tariff tweaks. Broader sentiment was underpinned by Prime Minister Modi’s hints at consumption-boosting GST reforms, positive global cues, sector-specific relief measures and robust institutional flows, which together fueled buying across IT, FMCG and realty counters and propelled the Sensex and Nifty back to fresh highs.
